<Question>

queries.e12aac0e-48c6-4135-aa5f-db79beb92991:

<Question>

<Construct>Construct a triangle using Angle-Side-Angle</Construct>
<Subject>Construct Triangle</Subject>
<Question>
Which of the following best describes how to construct a triangle with side length \( 7 \mathrm{~cm} \) with angles of \( 40^{\degree} \) and \( 50^{\degree} \) either side?
</Question>
<Answer>- Draw a line \( 7 \mathrm{~cm} \) long
- Place a protractor at one end of the line, measure \( 40^{\degree} \) and place a dot
- Place a protractor at the same end of the line, measure \( 50^{\degree} \) and place a dot
- Draw straight lines through the end of the lines through the dots
- Where these lines cross completes the triangle</Answer>

\(
\begin{array}{l}
2 x-3 y=10 \\
5 x+3 y=18
\end{array}
\) Katie says these equations are in an appropriate form
\(

2 x+y=4
\end{array}
\) Who is correct?
</Question>
<Answer>Only Tom</Answer>

 Pair \( 1 \)
\(
\begin{array}{l}
5 p+2 q=12 \\
3 p+2 q=8
\end{array}
\) Pair \( 2 \)
\(
\begin{array}{l}
5 p-2 q=12 \\
3 p-2 q=8
\end{array}
\)
</Question>

Subtract Pair \( 2 \)</Answer>
